[[lang code="de"]]

Gegeben sind die drei komplexen Zahlen \(\,z_1= {@z1@}\), \(\,z_2 = {@z2@}\,\) und \(\,z_3 = {@z3@}\,\).

Berechnen Sie den folgenden Ausdruck und schreiben Sie die resultierende komplexe Zahl als arithmetische Darstellung (z.B. \(a+b\cdot\mathrm{i}\) mit \(a,b \in \mathbb{R}\)).

\(\dfrac{z_1^{@c1@}\cdot z_2^{@c2@}}{z_3^{@c3_abs@}}=\,\) [[/lang]][[lang code="en"]]

The three complex numbers are given \(\,z_1= {@z1@}\), \(\,z_2 = {@z2@}\,\)and \(\,z_3 = {@z3@}\,\).

Calculate the following expression and write the resulting complex number as an arithmetic representation (e.g. \(a+b\cdot\mathrm{i}\) with \(a,b \in \mathbb{R}\)).

\(\dfrac{z_1^{@c1@}\cdot z_2^{@c2@}}{z_3^{@c3_abs@}}=\,\) [[/lang]][[input:ans1]][[lang code="de"]] [[/lang]][[lang code="en"]][[/lang]][[validation:ans1]][[lang code="de"]] [[/lang]][[lang code="en"]] [[/lang]][[feedback:prt1]][[lang code="de"]]

[[lang code="de"]] Lösungsweg:

Um den Ausdruck \(\dfrac{z_1^{@c1@}\cdot z_2^{@c2@}}{z_3^{@c3_abs@}}\) zu berechnen, werden die einzelnen Potenzen der drei komplexen Zahlen ermittelt.

(1) Die komplexe Zahl \(z_1= {@z1@}\), die im \(1\).Quadranten liegt, wird in die trigonometrische Form überführt.
Es ist \(|z_1| = \sqrt{(\mathrm{Re}(z_1))^2+(\mathrm{Im}(z_1))^2}\) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{\left({@z1_re@}\right)^{\!2} + \left({@z1_im@}\right)^{\!2}} \) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{{@z1_re^2@}+{@z1_im^2@}}\) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{{@z1_re^2+z1_im^2@}} = {@abs(z1)@}\).
Ferner ist \(\varphi_1 = \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left(\dfrac{\mathrm{Im}(z_1)}{\mathrm{Re}(z_1)}\right)\) \(= \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left(\dfrac{{@z1_im@}}{{@z1_re@}}\right)\) \(= \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left({@z1_im/z1_re@}\right)= {@phi1@}\).
Nach der Formel von Moivre gilt:
\(z_1^{@c1@} = |z_1|^{@c1@} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c1@} \cdot \varphi_1\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c1@} \cdot \varphi_1\right)\right)\) \(= \displaystyle \left({@abs(z1)@}\right)^{\!{@c1@}} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c1@} \cdot {@phi1@}\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c1@} \cdot {@phi1@}\right)\right)\) \(= \displaystyle {@abs(z1)^c1@} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c1*phi1@}\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c1*phi1@}\right)\right)\) \(= \displaystyle {@abs(z1)^c1@} \cdot \left({@cos(c1*phi1)+ %i*sin(c1*phi1)@}\right)\)

(2) Die komplexe Zahl \(z_2= {@z2@}\), die im \(1\).Quadranten liegt, wird in die trigonometrische Form überführt.
Es ist \(|z_2| = \sqrt{(\mathrm{Re}(z_2))^2+(\mathrm{Im}(z_2))^2}\) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{\left({@z2_re@}\right)^{\!2} + \left({@z2_im@}\right)^{\!2}} \) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{{@z2_re^2@}+{@z2_im^2@}}\) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{{@z2_re^2+z2_im^2@}} = {@abs(z2)@}\).
Ferner ist \(\varphi_2 = \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left(\dfrac{\mathrm{Im}(z_2)}{\mathrm{Re}(z_2)}\right)\) \(= \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left(\dfrac{{@z2_im@}}{{@z2_re@}}\right)\) \(= \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left({@z2_im/z2_re@}\right) = {@phi2@}\).

Nach der Formel von Moivre gilt:
\(z_2^{@c2@} = |z_2|^{@c2@} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c2@} \cdot \varphi_2\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c2@} \cdot \varphi_2\right)\right)\) \(= \displaystyle \left({@abs(z2)@}\right)^{\!{@c2@}} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c2@} \cdot {@phi2@}\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c2@} \cdot {@phi2@}\right)\right)\) \(= \displaystyle {@abs(z2)^c2@} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c2*phi2@}\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c2*phi2@}\right)\right)\) \(= \displaystyle {@abs(z2)^c2@} \cdot \left({@cos(c2*phi2)+ %i*sin(c2*phi2)@}\right)\)

(3) Die komplexe Zahl \(z_3= {@z3@}\), die im \(1\).Quadranten liegt, wird in die trigonometrische Form überführt.
Es ist \(|z_3| = \sqrt{(\mathrm{Re}(z_3))^2+(\mathrm{Im}(z_3))^2}\) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{\left({@z3_re@}\right)^{\!2} + \left({@z3_im@}\right)^{\!2}} \) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{{@z3_re^2@}+{@z3_im^2@}}\) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{{@z3_re^2+z3_im^2@}} = {@abs(z3)@}\).
Ferner ist \(\varphi_3 = \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left(\dfrac{\mathrm{Im}(z_3)}{\mathrm{Re}(z_3)}\right)\) \(= \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left(\dfrac{{@z3_im@}}{{@z3_re@}}\right)\) \(= \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left({@z3_im/z3_re@}\right) = {@phi3@}\).

Nach der Formel von Moivre gilt:
\(z_3^{@c3@} = |z_3|^{@c3@} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c3@} \cdot \varphi_3\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c3@} \cdot \varphi_3\right)\right)\) \(= \displaystyle \left({@abs(z3)@}\right)^{\!{@c3@}} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c3@} \cdot {@phi3@}\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c3@} \cdot {@phi3@}\right)\right)\) \(= \displaystyle {@abs(z3)^c3@} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c3*phi3@}\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c3*phi3@}\right)\right)\) \(= \displaystyle {@abs(z3)^c3@} \cdot \left({@cos(c3*phi3)+ %i*sin(c3*phi3)@}\right)\)

Somit ist  \(\dfrac{z_1^{@c1@}\cdot z_2^{@c2@}}{z_3^{@c3_abs@}} = z_1^{@c1@}\cdot z_2^{@c2@} \cdot z_3^{@c3@}\) \(= \displaystyle {@abs(z1)^c1@} \cdot \left({@cos(c1*phi1)+ %i*sin(c1*phi1)@}\right) \cdot {@abs(z2)^c2@} \cdot \left({@cos(c2*phi2)+ %i*sin(c2*phi2)@}\right) \cdot {@abs(z3)^c3@} \cdot \left({@cos(c3*phi3)+ %i*sin(c3*phi3)@}\right)\) \(= \displaystyle {@abs(z1)^c1*abs(z2)^c2*abs(z3)^c3@} \cdot \left({@cos(c1*phi1)+ %i*sin(c1*phi1)@}\right) \cdot \left({@cos(c2*phi2)+ %i*sin(c2*phi2)@}\right) \cdot \left({@cos(c3*phi3)+ %i*sin(c3*phi3)@}\right)\) \(= \displaystyle {@loes@}\)[[/lang]][[lang code="en"]] Solution:

To the expression \(\dfrac{z_1^{@c1@}\cdot z_2^{@c2@}}{z_3^{@c3_abs@}}\) the individual potencies of the three complex numbers are determined.

(1) The complex number \(z_1= {@z1@}\)in the \(1\).Quadrants are transferred to trigonometric form.
It is \(|z_1| = \sqrt{(\mathrm{Re}(z_1))^2+(\mathrm{Im}(z_1))^2}\) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{\left({@z1_re@}\right)^{\!2} + \left({@z1_im@}\right)^{\!2}} \) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{{@z1_re^2@}+{@z1_im^2@}}\) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{{@z1_re^2+z1_im^2@}} = {@abs(z1)@}\).
Furthermore, \(\varphi_1 = \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left(\dfrac{\mathrm{Im}(z_1)}{\mathrm{Re}(z_1)}\right)\) \(= \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left(\dfrac{{@z1_im@}}{{@z1_re@}}\right)\)\(= \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left({@z1_im/z1_re@}\right)= {@phi1@}\).
According to the formula of Moivre:
\(z_1^{@c1@} = |z_1|^{@c1@} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c1@} \cdot \varphi_1\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c1@} \cdot \varphi_1\right)\right)\) \(= \displaystyle \left({@abs(z1)@}\right)^{\!{@c1@}} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c1@} \cdot {@phi1@}\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c1@} \cdot {@phi1@}\right)\right)\)\(= \displaystyle {@abs(z1)^c1@} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c1*phi1@}\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c1*phi1@}\right)\right)\)\(= \displaystyle {@abs(z1)^c1@} \cdot \left({@cos(c1*phi1)+ %i*sin(c1*phi1)@}\right)\)

(2) The complex number \(z_2= {@z2@}\)in the \(1\).Quadrants are transferred to trigonometric form.
It is \(|z_2| = \sqrt{(\mathrm{Re}(z_2))^2+(\mathrm{Im}(z_2))^2}\) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{\left({@z2_re@}\right)^{\!2} + \left({@z2_im@}\right)^{\!2}} \) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{{@z2_re^2@}+{@z2_im^2@}}\) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{{@z2_re^2+z2_im^2@}} = {@abs(z2)@}\).
Furthermore, \(\varphi_2 = \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left(\dfrac{\mathrm{Im}(z_2)}{\mathrm{Re}(z_2)}\right)\) \(= \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left(\dfrac{{@z2_im@}}{{@z2_re@}}\right)\)\(= \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left({@z2_im/z2_re@}\right) = {@phi2@}\).

According to the formula of Moivre:
\(z_2^{@c2@} = |z_2|^{@c2@} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c2@} \cdot \varphi_2\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c2@} \cdot \varphi_2\right)\right)\) \(= \displaystyle \left({@abs(z2)@}\right)^{\!{@c2@}} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c2@} \cdot {@phi2@}\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c2@} \cdot {@phi2@}\right)\right)\)\(= \displaystyle {@abs(z2)^c2@} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c2*phi2@}\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c2*phi2@}\right)\right)\)\(= \displaystyle {@abs(z2)^c2@} \cdot \left({@cos(c2*phi2)+ %i*sin(c2*phi2)@}\right)\)

(3) The complex number \(z_3= {@z3@}\)in the \(1\).Quadrants are transferred to trigonometric form.
It is \(|z_3| = \sqrt{(\mathrm{Re}(z_3))^2+(\mathrm{Im}(z_3))^2}\) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{\left({@z3_re@}\right)^{\!2} + \left({@z3_im@}\right)^{\!2}} \) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{{@z3_re^2@}+{@z3_im^2@}}\) \(= \displaystyle \sqrt{{@z3_re^2+z3_im^2@}} = {@abs(z3)@}\).
Furthermore, \(\varphi_3 = \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left(\dfrac{\mathrm{Im}(z_3)}{\mathrm{Re}(z_3)}\right)\) \(= \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left(\dfrac{{@z3_im@}}{{@z3_re@}}\right)\)\(= \displaystyle  \arctan\!\left({@z3_im/z3_re@}\right) = {@phi3@}\).

According to the formula of Moivre:
\(z_3^{@c3@} = |z_3|^{@c3@} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c3@} \cdot \varphi_3\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c3@} \cdot \varphi_3\right)\right)\) \(= \displaystyle \left({@abs(z3)@}\right)^{\!{@c3@}} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c3@} \cdot {@phi3@}\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c3@} \cdot {@phi3@}\right)\right)\)\(= \displaystyle {@abs(z3)^c3@} \cdot \left(\cos\left({@c3*phi3@}\right) + \mathrm{i} \cdot \sin\left({@c3*phi3@}\right)\right)\)\(= \displaystyle {@abs(z3)^c3@} \cdot \left({@cos(c3*phi3)+ %i*sin(c3*phi3)@}\right)\)

Thus,\(\dfrac{z_1^{@c1@}\cdot z_2^{@c2@}}{z_3^{@c3_abs@}} = z_1^{@c1@}\cdot z_2^{@c2@} \cdot z_3^{@c3@}\) \(= \displaystyle {@abs(z1)^c1@} \cdot \left({@cos(c1*phi1)+ %i*sin(c1*phi1)@}\right) \cdot {@abs(z2)^c2@} \cdot \left({@cos(c2*phi2)+ %i*sin(c2*phi2)@}\right) \cdot {@abs(z3)^c3@} \cdot \left({@cos(c3*phi3)+ %i*sin(c3*phi3)@}\right)\) \(= \displaystyle {@abs(z1)^c1*abs(z2)^c2*abs(z3)^c3@} \cdot \left({@cos(c1*phi1)+ %i*sin(c1*phi1)@}\right) \cdot \left({@cos(c2*phi2)+ %i*sin(c2*phi2)@}\right) \cdot \left({@cos(c3*phi3)+ %i*sin(c3*phi3)@}\right)\)\(= \displaystyle {@loes@}\)[[/lang]]
